alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:03PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Essex, southwestern Addison and northwestern Rutland Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 902 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eighth Lake Campground to near Lake Durant Campground to 9 miles southwest of North Creek. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Minerva, Newcomb, Schroon Lake, Benson, Orwell, North Hudson, Olmstedville, Chipman Point, Schroon Falls, Coates Point, Black Point, Grass Island, Chilson, Chipmans Point, Vanderwhacker Mountain, Paradox, South Schroon, Underwood, Pharoah Mountain, and Steep Bay. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 82 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
